title: Particle Motion Analysis
driving_question: How can we analyze the motion of a particle in the xy-plane over a given time interval using calculus?
short_background_context: In this mission, we will explore a problem from the AP Calculus BC exam. The problem involves a particle moving along a curve in the xy-plane. The particle's position at any given time t seconds is given by the coordinates (x(t), y(t)). We will use calculus to analyze the particle's motion, including its speed, total distance traveled, and changes in its y-coordinate over specific time intervals. We will also determine when the particle is moving towards the x-axis. This mission will help you understand how calculus can be used to analyze real-world problems involving motion.
tasks: Task 1: Calculate the speed of the particle at time t=2 seconds.
Task 2: Determine the total distance traveled by the particle over the time interval 0≤t≤2.
Task 3: Find the y-coordinate of the particle's position at time t=0.
pre_thinking_prompts: What is the relationship between speed and distance?
How can we use calculus to find the speed of a particle at a specific time?
How can we calculate the total distance traveled by a particle over a given time interval?
reflection_prompt: What did you learn about using calculus to analyze the motion of a particle? How could these concepts be applied to other real-world problems?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why you chose that method to calculate the speed?
What does the integral represent in the context of this problem?
Why is it important to consider the sign of y'(t) when determining the direction of the particle's motion?
remix_zone: Students could remix this problem by changing the equations for x(t) and y(t), or by analyzing the particle's motion over a different time interval.
